Race.SpecificTitle: Sales Tax District No. 1 -- 1/4% S&U - PJ
Race.SummaryText:
Sales Tax District No. 1 Proposition 
(Sales Tax)

Summary:  1/4% sales and use tax of Sales Tax District No. 1 to be used to provide fire protection in the District through the acquisition, construction, improvement, operation, maintenance and support of equipment, property and facilities to be used for fire protection purposes, including payment of personnel costs and the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, with the proceeds of the tax to be subject to being funded into bonds.
Race.FullText: Shall Sales Tax District No. 1 of the Parish of Lincoln, State of Louisiana (the "District"), under the provisions of Section 2721.6 of Title 33 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended, and other constitutional and statutory authority, be authorized to levy and collect a tax of one-fourth of one-percent (1/4%) (the "Tax") upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption, and the storage for use or consumption, of tangible personal property and on sales of services in the District, all as defined by law (an estimated $700,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected for the levy of the Tax for an entire year), from and after January 1, 2009, with the avails or proceeds of the Tax (after paying the reasonable and necessary cost and expenses of collecting and administering the Tax) to be dedicated and used to provide fire protection in the District through the acquisition, construction, improvement, operation, maintenance and support of equipment, property and facilities to be used for fire protection purposes, including payment of personnel costs and the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, and shall the District be further authorized to fund the proceeds of the Tax into bonds for any of the capital purposes set forth above to the extent in the manner permitted by laws of Louisiana, including Sub-Part F, Part III, Chapter 4, Title 39 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended?
